settingsPane.description: Here you can choose whether to apply Dorimanx App settings on BOOT or not.
settingsPane.name: Global BOOT Settings

spinner.description: Master Switch - load ALL settings from ALL tabs on BOOT or not! Default is LOAD.
spinner.name: Enable On Boot

spinnerItem.name: Don't load all Settings on boot

button.description: Push this in order to load all tuned settings IF the master switch is (or was already) OFF. If the master switch was ON when phone booted, then you don't need to touch this, wait until Dorimanx App will reload.
button.name: LOAD ALL
button.label: LOAD ALL

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune the CPU Active Governor per core best to set ONDEMAND on core0 for stability.
settingsPane.name: CPU Active Governor

spinner.description: This will set the CPU0 governor. YOU CAN ONLY USE FEW GOVS On CORE0! dont ask to add others. they not stable on core0
spinner.name: Default CPU0 Governor

spinner.description: This will set the CPU1 governor.
spinner.name: Default CPU1 Governor

spinner.description: This will set the CPU2 governor.
spinner.name: Default CPU2 Governor

spinner.description: This will set the CPU3 governor.
spinner.name: Default CPU3 Governor

seekBar.description: Here you can set ZZMOOVE Profile Number
seekBar.name: ZZMOOVE Profile Number

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune the Touch Boost Controls
settingsPane.name: Touch Boost Controls

spinner.description: Touch boost control - when you touch the screen or scroll, the CPU's frequency will be boosted to maximum frequency set in order to help reducing LAG and allow fast and smooth operations. Too high frequencies will use more power.
spinner.name: Touch Boost Frequency-CPU0

spinner.description: Touch boost frequency for CPU1
spinner.name: Touch Boost Frequency-CPU1

spinner.description: Touch boost frequency for CPU2
spinner.name: Touch Boost Frequency-CPU2

spinner.description: Touch boost frequency for CPU3
spinner.name: Touch Boost Frequency-CPU3

seekBar.description: Here you can set Touch Boost duration in miliseconds! 10ms is equal 0.01sec, it's the time that core is locked on it's min frequency to one you set here on touch! it's Ultra Fast!
seekBar.name: CPU Touch Boost duration

seekBar.description: Touch Boost duration in miliseconds!
seekBar.name: CPU Touch Boost duration

seekBar.description: Here you can set Touch Boost interval in miliseconds! 100ms is equal 0.1sec, when touch screen report touch here we set timer for how long to wait before setting core min frequency for duration above, this is Ultra Fast even on 500ms
seekBar.name: CPU Touch Boost Interval

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Hotplug Boost
checkbox.name: Hotplug-Boost
checkbox.label: Hotplug-Boost

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Load based syncs
checkbox.name: load-based-syncs
checkbox.label: load-based-syncs

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Wakeup Boost
checkbox.name: Wakeup-boost
checkbox.label: Wakeup-boost

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune the CPU Power
settingsPane.name: CPU Power Controls

seekBar.description: Here you can select CPU governor sample rate when using Power Save mode below, lower the value faster responce you get, but more power drained.
seekBar.name: CPU Governor Sample Rate

spinner.description: Here you can select 2 modes! one for power save! and one for performance!, On power save responce will be normal! when performance mode selected, high presure responce allowed with max power CPU governor will be tuned with 10000 sample rate and above tuning is ignored!.
spinner.name: Power Save Switch

checkbox.description: Enable or disable Power-efficient Workqueues will help to reduce power consumption at the cost of slight performance overhead. By enabling this, PE workqueues are used for unbound scheduled work to save load on sibling CPU cores and queuing work on CPU 0.
checkbox.name: Power-efficient Workqueues
checkbox.label: Power-efficient Workqueues

checkbox.description: Enable or disable CPU-Tweaks below! If ON, then kernel will obey only Dorimanx App and set the frequencies selected below, on screen OFF and ON
checkbox.name: CPU-Tweaks
checkbox.label: CPU-Tweaks

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune the Maximum CPU Frequency per core, when set here no other APP or Service can set higher!!!
settingsPane.name: Maximum CPU Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum CPU0 Speed. Here, you can change the maximum CPU0 frequency allowed. This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 2265600 Khz)
spinner.name: Max CPU0 Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum CPU1 Speed. Here, you can change the maximum CPU1 frequency allowed. This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 2265600 Khz)
spinner.name: Max CPU1 Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum CPU2 Speed. Here, you can change the maximum CPU2 frequency allowed. This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 2265600 Khz)
spinner.name: Max CPU2 Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum CPU3 Speed. Here, you can change the maximum CPU3 frequency allowed. This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 2265600 Khz)
spinner.name: Max CPU3 Frequency

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune the Minimum CPU Frequency per core
settingsPane.name: Minimum CPU Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU0 Speed. Here, you can change the minimum CPU0 frequency allowed (it can't be higher than Maximum CPU0 Speed). This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 300000 Khz)
spinner.name: Min CPU0 Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU1 Speed. Here, you can change the minimum CPU1 frequency allowed (it can't be higher than Maximum CPU1 Speed). This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 300000 Khz)
spinner.name: Min CPU1 Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU2 Speed. Here, you can change the minimum CPU2 frequency allowed (it can't be higher than Maximum CPU2 Speed). This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 300000 Khz)
spinner.name: Min CPU2 Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU3 Speed. Here, you can change the minimum CPU3 frequency allowed (it can't be higher than Maximum CPU3 Speed). This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 300000 Khz)
spinner.name: Min CPU3 Frequency

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune the Maximum Suspend Frequency on core0 it's only one that work.
settingsPane.name: Max Suspend Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum allowed CPU frequency when screen is OFF and phone is awake (by any app that holds wakelocks, such as music apps etc.) This is ONLY for screen OFF. When screen is ON, normal maximum allowed frequency will be set.
spinner.name: MAX Screen OFF CPU Frequency

button.description: To access CPU LIVE Stats from my kernel PUSH the BUTTON!
button.name: CPU LIVE Stats
button.label: Switch to Synapse Controls

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune CPU Thermal Controls, with this kernel ROM thermal service and Intelligent Thermal Kernel driver can be enabled together! To protect your device from overheating and melting the chipset, screen and your fingers! Controls below are active for Dual Intelligent Temp Control. In case the ROM service dies, kernel will protect your chipset, LCD and other components from damage! only if Dual Intelligent Temp Control is used
settingsPane.name: CPU Thermal Protection

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Thermal Monitor
checkbox.name: Thermal Monitor
checkbox.label: Thermal Monitor

spinner.description: CPU Thermal control, Can be Default driver without controls, or Dual Intelligent Thermal driver with controls below and ROM thermal control, it will limit CPU frequency when CPU reach the max limit heat, till cooled and restore full power, by using Default Temp Control you have one temp protection by ROM, and if ROM stuck and hotboot there is no one to protect your CPU from heat up the LCD and burn it. BUT you get better game performance by using ONE protection. when Dual Intelligent Temp Control enabled, kernel protects your hardware in any condition! reboot or hotboot! or any other problem. also it's possible to use only Intelligent Temp Control, then ROM service is turned OFF. only kernel control the CPU temp.
spinner.name: CPU Temp Control

seekBar.description: Here you can adjust the temperature CPU cores can reach before they are throttled down in order to allow the CPU to cool down and keep the phone at normal temperature.
seekBar.name: CPU Max Heat

seekBar.description: Here you can adjust the temperature to start shutting down Cores.
seekBar.name: CPU Max Heat

seekBar.description: Here you can adjust the Frequency control mask
seekBar.name: Frequency control mask

seekBar.description: Here you can adjust the Temp Pull Timer interval, lower set force driver to check temp faster and tune max frequency
seekBar.name: Temp Pull Timer

seekBar.description: Here you can adjust the Wakeup Timer
seekBar.name: Wakeup Timer

seekBar.description: Here you can adjust the number of Core that can be Offline
seekBar.name: core number

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune HotPlug CPU Thermal Controls, ON or OFF cores when over temp to reduce heat. but this will reduce performance, as you get one core enabled but on full power! others will wait till heat will be reduced.
settingsPane.name: HotPlug CPU Thermal Controls

spinner.description: Hotplug CPU Thermal control main switch, this allow to shutdown cores 1,2,3 and leave core 0 as main core on high frequency. but it's reduces global performance on high temp, if set disabled then all CPU cores will be online and operate at lower frequencies when the temperature is high!
spinner.name: HotPlug Thermal CPU Control

spinner.description: Here you can control how many cores will stay active on high temp, more cores OFF will give you higher frequency on cores that remain Online, disabled Cores can go online by auto if temp is below the set mark in control below, Change will take effect ONLY on LOW Temp! do not change on high CPU stress, depend on Hotplug CPU Thermal control Enabled above!
spinner.name: Max online CPU's

seekBar.description: Here you can change HotPlug CORES Max Heat before turning OFF cores from 3 to 1 and keep normal phone heat. you need to set this control BELOW Max TEMP Control in above section! then cores will go down when overheated! Depends on Intelli CPU Cores Control (must be ENABLED)!
seekBar.name: Intelli CORE Max Heat

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune CPU HotPlug and CPU Governors
settingsPane.name: Global HOTPLUG

spinner.description: CPU HotPlug Control - you can switch from OLD LG Default Hot Plug driver to MSM Hot Plug, Intelligent Hot Plug or Alucard driver. Note that using Intelligent CPU Thermal Control with Default LG HotPlug is NOT recommended (low performance)!
spinner.name: Hot Plug Driver

spinner.description: CPU HotPlug Suspend Control - you can allow hotplug to be suspended when screen is OFF to save little more power on deepsleep, then resume when screen is ON, BUT it's will DELAY In Call screen wakeup! for 2sec as when screen is OFF, you have only ONE core active with suspend mode. also using suspend mode can prevent wake up for some devices for unknown reason!!!. so if you wish to test suspend mode go ahead, if you get SOD switch to Always Active mode and stay there. for many it's working fine. this is for all kernel hotplugs, default hotplug is not supported.
spinner.name: Hot Plug Suspend Mode

spinner.description: Additional CPU HotPlug control - here you can tune how many cores will be active on a high load spikes for a short time (default is 2 cores for 4 sec). If you wish to save more power when using MSM or Intelligent HotPlug, then it is best to use 1 core boost. If performance is what you prefer, then use DUAL or more cores boost. Depend on MSM or Intelligent Hot Plug selected!
spinner.name: Hot Plug CPU Booster

seekBar.description: Here you can adjust the CPU BOOST time duration, when hotplug turn the amount of boosted cpus on spike load. it's for MSM and INTELLIGENT Hotplugs only! 1000msec equal 1sec (default is 1000msec)
seekBar.name: CPU Booster Duration

spinner.description: Maximum allowed CPU Cores online - you can have QUAD CORE, or select CPU CORE type that you want, This mod will work with all custom hotplugs! Default LG hotplug is not supported. This set is stronger than MIN cores online below!
spinner.name: Max Cores online

spinner.description: Minimum allowed CPU Cores online - here you can set the minimum number of CPU cores to be online nonstop when screen is ON. By default, we have only one core online when device is idle. You can set 2, 3 or all 4 if you wish - this will give your device much more power, but will drain the battery faster and warm up the device faster. Default is NORMAL (one core online + other cores offline until needed). This setting is weaker than MAX cores online above! If you set 2 max cores online and 4 min cores online, you get 2 cores max.
spinner.name: Min CPU Online

settingsPane.description: Here you can select the GPU Governor, set Min and Max GPU frequency and update tuning.
settingsPane.name: GPU Governors and settings

spinner.description: Select GPU Governor that will control GPU frequency according to GPU load and system needs - if you select Performance Governor, then the GPU will be at MAX frequency nonstop!
spinner.name: GPU Active Governor

button.description: To update GPU Governor tuning after selection, Push This
button.name: Update GPU Governor Tuning
button.label: Update GPU Governor

spinner.description: Select GPU Max frequency when needed! GPU will stay at MIN frequency on IDLE.
spinner.name: GPU Max Speed

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune Msm-Adreno-Tz Governor! Use the controls ONLY if Msm-Adreno-Tz is selected (otherwise nothing will happen).
settingsPane.name: Msm-Adreno-Tz Controls

spinner.description: Here you can manually control Simple_ramp_threshold and Simple_laziness value, or let the Governor decide automatically. If set to AUTO, then controls below have no effect.
spinner.name: Msm-Adreno-Tz Extra Controls

seekBar.description: Msm-Adreno-Tz Simple_Laziness control, here you can set the amount of steps to wait on high freq before reducing lower if nothing for GPU to do. higher set here, more battery drained, but more smooth UI (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: Simple_Laziness Value

seekBar.description: Msm-Adreno-Tz Simple_ramp_threshold control, higher is set here, longer GPU freq will stay LOW on GPU load. (Default: 6000)
seekBar.name: Simple_Laziness Value

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune Adreno Idler Parameters.
settingsPane.name: Adreno-Idler Controls

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Adreno Idler
checkbox.name: Adreno-Idler
checkbox.label: Adreno Idler Active

seekBar.description: Adreno Idler Down Differential
seekBar.name: Adreno Idler Down Differential

seekBar.description: Adreno Idler Idle Wait
seekBar.name: Adreno Idler Idle Wait

seekBar.description: Adreno Idler Idle Workload
seekBar.name: Adreno Idler Idle Workload

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune I/O settings managed by Kernel
settingsPane.name: I/O Tuning

spinner.description: Maximum number of kilobytes to read-ahead for SDCARD! It's best to leave it at 1024 KB. (Default equal 1024 KB)
spinner.name: kilobytes to read-ahead

spinner.description: MMC power usage control, when set performance mode MMC I/O write speed will be very fast, when set in power save mode write performance will be degraded but more power saved.
spinner.name: MMC Power Usage

button.description: Use this button to Trim System and Data Nand partitions to speed up Read and Write Access, good to use once in a day or two.
button.name: Trim System and Data
button.label: Trim NOW

spinner.description: This will set the default AWAKE I/O scheduler for internal storage. (Default equal ZEN)
spinner.name: Default Awake I/O Scheduler

spinner.description: This will set the DEEPSLEEP I/O scheduler for internal storage. Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process! (Default equal ZEN)
spinner.name: DEEPSLEEP I/O Scheduler

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune memory and OOM (low memory management) settings managed by the kernel.
settingsPane.name: Memory Tuning

checkbox.description: Enable AUTO OOM control using the profiles below; disable if you want to set your own OOM tuning via another app or script.
checkbox.name: Auto OOM
checkbox.label: Auto OOM Control

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low memory management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen ON

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low memory management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen OFF

seekBar.description: Dirty background memory buffer. The more you set, the more memory will be used for write buffer for background operations. Buffer is released when it is needed to free RAM
seekBar.name: Dirty Background ratio

seekBar.description: Dirty real time memory buffer. The more you set, the more memory will be used for write buffer for real time operations. Buffer is released when it is needed to free RAM
seekBar.name: Dirty ratio

button.description: Clean RAM Cache - this will release all cached and buffered RAM. WAIT 3 sec to get cleanup report!
button.name: CLEAN RAM CACHE
button.label: CLEAN RAM CACHE NOW

settingsPane.description: Here you can activate some scripts which will automatically run in the background at a specified time.
settingsPane.name: cron

spinner.description: Main switch for Cron Tasker. If you set this to OFF, then all tasks below have no effect!
spinner.name: CRON TASK MAIN SWITCH

button.description: Use this button to test if this Cron Task service is ONLINE and supported! If main switch is ON and service is OFFLINE, then ROM Busybox is not supporting Cron. Update Busybox or ROM for this to work.
button.name: Test Cron Task Service
button.label: Test Cron Task Service

button.description: Use this button to RESET the scripts and jobs from kernel, to refresh the configuration. This will clear all your custom changes!
button.name: CRON RESET
button.label: RESET CRON

checkbox.description: Cron to clear file-cache every hour, but only if CPU is resting (IDLE) and more than 50% of your memory is used! This will free RAM from unused buffers and cache.
checkbox.name: Clean file-cache
checkbox.label: RAM cache clean every hour

checkbox.description: Enable restarting google services to release memory leak and cpu non stop activity, this is one of the LP RAM leak BUGS. service can stuck, drain RAM and force CPU to work non stop. fix this by restarting the service every 3 hours.
checkbox.name: Google service restart
checkbox.label: Restart LP google service every 3 hours

checkbox.description: Enable Battery Calibration every week at SAT 6:00AM UTC time, to correct wrong calculation or remaining charge
checkbox.name: Calibrate Battery every week
checkbox.label: Calibrate Battery Every Week

checkbox.description: Cron to update AD-BLOCKER every week at SAT 6:00AM UTC time, from official site. The script will check, if you are connected with the internet, otherwise it will try to use WIFI! Script will turn wifi, wait for connection and update, then when it is finished it will turn WIFI off. If there is no connection, an error will be written in the log.
checkbox.name: Update AD-Block
checkbox.label: Update AD-BLOCKER every week

checkbox.description: Cron to DB Optimize every day at 3:00 AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)!
checkbox.name: DB Optimization
checkbox.label: DB Optimization task every day at 3:00 AM

checkbox.description: Cron to clear app-cache every day at 4:00 AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)!
checkbox.name: Clean app-cache
checkbox.label: Disk Clean task every day at 4:00 AM

button.description: Use this button to check if Cron Task Jobs are done as requested. This will show the log for all finished jobs.
button.name: Test Cron Task jobs
button.label: Test Cron Task Jobs

settingsPane.description: Here you can find some settings and options for your apps.
settingsPane.name: Apps

button.description: Click here to start applications Database Optimization. Compacting, cleaning and indexing will take max 2 minutes.
button.name: DB OPTIMIZATION
button.label: DATABASE OPTIMIZATON

button.description: Click here to see current SELINUX status! ON or OFF globaly. default is OFF, you can turn it ON with button below.
button.name: SELINUX STATUS CHECK
button.label: SELINUX STATUS CHECK

button.description: Click here to Enable or Disable Selinux Driver in Kernel! if selinux is OFF apps may get access to files in system but not change them, BUT if you have ROOT, they can! with or without selinux. if SELINUX is disabled! (default set on boot) then life is good! and all works! no problems with GSM connection or access permissions with differnt apps. when you push this button ONCE, kernel command line is updated and current kernel is reinstalled by auto!. so dont play with this too much. to see the change you need to REBOOT! then you can check using check button above! WARNING some USER apps loose some or all data! (mostly configurations) as permissions change. do app backup before switching selinux to ENABLE! no problem with DISABLE
button.name: SELINUX ON OFF CONTROL
button.label: SELINUX HARD ON OFF

spinner.description: Allows you to change your SELinux (Security-Enhanced Linux) Status from Enforcing (policy is enforced) to Permissive (prints warnings instead of enforcing). ONCE YOU CHANGE TO ENFORCE! THIS CONTROL APP WILL NEVER WORK AGAIN. till you reset profiles by deleting data-.gabriel folder and reboot or run setenforce 0 or use some app to change selinux to permissive. then go here and set Permissive
spinner.name: SeLinux Control

settingsPane.description: Screen Backlight Control, here you can set custom values for Auto backlight driver.
settingsPane.name: Min Backlight Control

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable custom backlight override set below, this will allow user to set MIN backlight in full darkness.
checkbox.name: Min Backlight Override Switch
checkbox.label: Min Backlight Override Switch

seekBar.description: If custom backlight switch is ON above!, you can set the MIN backlight in dark place, if you feel that screen is too bright! or too dark! in order for change to take effect you need to make the screen brighter then set auto, and see that it's will be darker or brighter than was on default. you can see live change only if current LUX is under 60! (Default MIN ROM value equal 60 and its just 3 persent backlight)
seekBar.name: Min Backlight Level

settingsPane.description: Congestion control concerns controlling traffic entry into a telecommunications network, so as to avoid congestive collapse by attempting to avoid oversubscription of any of the processing or link capabilities of the intermediate nodes and networks and taking resource reducing steps.
settingsPane.name: Net Congestion Control

spinner.description: Allow USER to READ GOOGLE! Then come here and select what he thinks is BEST for him for NET Congestion Control. If USER is lazy to read Google!, then leave it as default (CUBIC or BIC depend on model) and don't ask what is the difference!
spinner.name: Net Congestion Control

settingsPane.description: WIFI Settings
settingsPane.name: WIFI

button.description: Clean WIFI DHCP IP Lease. Push the button to activate!
button.name: Clean WIFI Lease
button.label: Clean WIFI Lease

settingsPane.description: Here you can change GPS and NTP settings.
settingsPane.name: GPS - NTP

spinner.description: GPS Time Zone for faster GPS lock! Use your region!
spinner.name: GPS Region

button.description: Click to see your current GPS ZONE
button.name: GPS ZONE
button.label: GPS ZONE CHECK

settingsPane.description: Here you can Add, Update or Remove AD Blocker! You need ROOT to do the tweak! If you want to update the blocker, you can push the UPDATE AD NOW button, to get the new one installed! If you install a new ROM, and you want to use AD BLOCKER, then push UPDATE AD NOW and REBOOT. If you need to REMOVE AD-BLOCKER use the REMOVE button and REBOOT
settingsPane.name: AD Blocker

button.description: ADD or UPDATE AD BLOCKER
button.name: AD-B UPDATE or ADD
button.label: UPDATE AD-B NOW

button.description: REMOVE AD Blocker
button.name: AD-B REMOVE
button.label: REMOVE AD-B NOW

checkbox.description: Enable or disable INIT.D scripts to RUN on boot. If you put scripts in INIT.D, then enable the switch. Default SuperSu script will run on boot by kernel from init.d.
checkbox.name: INIT.D Scripts RUN control
checkbox.label: Enable INIT.D scripts RUN-control

settingsPane.description: Android Additional Logs and logcat.
settingsPane.name: Logcat Logger

spinner.description: Enable or disable Android Additional Logs and logcat. it's Always Disabled to save power.
spinner.name: Android Logcat Logger

spinnerItem.name: Enabled only when screen is ON

settingsPane.description: Here you can found Supported Tweaks
settingsPane.name: Reset Battery Fuel Counter

button.description: Here you can RESET battery fuel counter, if you see that battery present counter is not showing correct state, you can ask kernel to recalibrate battery state.
button.name: Reset Battery Counter
button.label: Reset Battery Counter

settingsPane.description: Enable using Android phone as USB keyboard for your PC! Let's say you don't have a keyboard and you really need one! disconnect USB!!! make sure you are in MTP mode!!! enable the mode! Connect your phone via USB, get the app named USB KEYBOARD, and have fun!
settingsPane.name: Android USB HID Device

spinner.description: Enable or disable USB HID Device driver to control PC keyboard and mouse from phone! MUST BE IN MTP MODE(not LG Software)!!! or you will get blue screen in your PC!
spinner.name: USB HID Device

settingsPane.description: Rooted ADB control.
settingsPane.name: Rootted ADB

spinner.description: Allow ROOTED ADB shell by default, no SU needed, or use more secure and original by LG, developers need direct access to system via adb, so it's can be done by using DEV ROOTED ADB
spinner.name: ADB Selector

settingsPane.description: This script will manipulate many kernel settings, based on chosen Dorimanx App profile + settings and screen state (ON or OFF) - we call it CortexBrain. To reset the kernel-settings after you disable a tweak, you must reboot!
settingsPane.name: CortexBrain Tweaks

spinner.description: Enable or disable the background-process from CortexBrain. If you disable it, you will lose the function that sets different settings for screen state (ON or OFF).
spinner.name: Cortexbrain-Background-Process

button.description: Click to see if the CortexBrain-Background-Process is running or not.
button.name: Check Background-Process
button.label: CHECK SERVICE

checkbox.description: Enable or disable Memory-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: Memory-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Memory-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or disable System-Tweak (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: System-Tweaks
checkbox.label: System-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or disable Kernel-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: Kernel-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Kernel-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or disable I/O-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: I/O-Tweaks
checkbox.label: I/O-Tweaks

settingsPane.description: You can check what profile is in use right now.
settingsPane.name: Online Profile

button.description: This displays your currently used profile.
button.name: Profile Check
button.label: Profile Check

settingsPane.description: Here you can choose kernel profiles.
settingsPane.name: Dorimanx App Profiles

settingsPane.description: Here you can backup or restore your profile after installing new kernel. Some settings will work only after reboot! Restore will take up to 30 sec, just wait!
settingsPane.name: Config Backup or Restore

button.description: Backup Dorimanx App User Settings!
button.name: Settings Backup
button.label: BACKUP NOW

button.description: Restore Dorimanx App User Settings!
button.name: Settings Restore
button.label: RESTORE NOW

settingsPane.description: Debug to SD-Card
settingsPane.name: Bug-Report

button.description: Bug-Report for Kernel
button.name: Kernel-Bug
button.label: KERNEL-BUG

button.description: Bug-Report for Apps
button.name: App-Bug
button.label: APP-BUG
